comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: "The inland country of Jersey is notable for the charm of its rural lanes. Fresh green hedgerows and overarching trees give shaded vistas of rustic beauty. The photograph shows Vinchelez Lane through which one passes on the way to Plemont. The typically Norman arched gateway [on left] is in the walls of the old Manor House of Vinchelez de Bas. Above the arch are the arms of the De Carterets and the Dumaresqs with the date 1730." — From verso of Cigarette Card, "Vinchelez Lane, Jersey", George Arents Collection, New York Public Library
